lead_paragraph: To help city deal with lead-contaminated water, the State House approved $30 million to help pay residents’ water bills and Gov. Rick Snyder announced a $2 million grant to help city replace pipes.

headline.print_headline: Michigan: More Money on Way for Flint Crisis
headline.main: Michigan: More Money on Way for Flint Crisis

snippet: To help city deal with lead-contaminated water, the State House approved $30 million to help pay residents’ water bills and Gov. Rick Snyder announced a $2 million grant to help city replace pipes.
abstract: Michigan State House approves $30 million to help Flint residents pay water bills and Gov Rick Snyder reveals $2 million grant to help Flint pay for replacement pipes; federal government will give $500,000 to fund two health centers that are treating and testing residents exposed to lead-contaminated water.
